instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Mac arrived dead! PPBus was 4v. After changing resistors R7020, R7021 and U7000, I now have 12.56v.

RTC_RESET_L - 3.26V
PCH_INTRUDER_L - 1.65v
PCH_INTVRMEN - 2.5v
PCH_SRTCRST_L - 3.26V

PPBUS_G3H - 12.56v
PP3V42_G3H - 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H - 3,3V
PP5V_S5 - 5v
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V
*PP3V3_SUS - 0v
SMC_ONOFF_L - 3,37v


SMC_ADAPTER_EN - 3.3V
SMC_PM_G2_EN - 3.4V
*PM_BATLOW_L - 0v
PM_PWRBTN_L - 3.4V
*PM_RSMRST_L - 0v
PLT_RESET_L - 0v
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 3.3v

SMC_RESET_L 3.1v and Y5010 0v (SMC_extal and SMC_xtal_r)

See the U4900 on page 45. The components and traces Ok. The PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC line is 0v.

SMC problems?

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
"PCH_INTRUDER_L - 1.65v"
This looks bad.
Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH; heat with quality flux.
If no change, replace R1801 with 100-330K.

"*PM_BATLOW_L - 0v"
Are you using original 60/85W charger for sure?

"ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 3.3v"
Please post accurate information!
You don't get 3V3_SUS yet; how do you get PM_SLP_S3L???

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
I changed the R1801 and now I have 3v, but I still have no green led and dead board.

Yes, I am using original charger 85W

Sorry, I got confused when typing the lines. ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 0v.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
You must get 1-1.2V at Y5110 (DC voltage).
If not, change all related components and reball SMC.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
I'm going to try reballing in SMC.

I found that the board turns on with a charged battery. Recognizes charger but does not charge.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Battery can't be charged, until get Magsafe light.

Unfortunately, I'm not so sure about your readings.
Board can't turn on without 12MHz at Y5010.
With battery, Y5010 starts after pressing power button.

Do you get SMC_BC_ACOK?
Did you test another DCIN board?
Did you try SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
I don't have an oscilloscope to test the Y5010. I just checked the voltage.

I have SMC_BC_ACOK 2.2v and on SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC 3.42v.

Tested with another DCIN, same thing.

It works with SMC bypass!

I did the reballing in SMC, it didn't work.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Post all voltages of U6900.
Check continuity from it to DCIN board.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
U6900 - pin 1, 4, 5 - 3.44v
perfect continuity!

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: Try another SMC...

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: It took me a while, but I got some SMC chips. I changed it, but the problem remains. Any more suggestions?

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: Machine still works with charged battery?

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: Yes it works.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: You should check continuity from U6900 to SMC pad; when SMC was removed.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
I checked the line in the SMC and it's ok.

I noticed the lack of the pin 143 pad, NC_SMC_HIB_L

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
So board works in normal mode with battery, but only turns on in SMC bypass with charger alone (no battery)?
Did you try another charger?

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Complicated!

After I removed the SMC to check the U6900 line, it won't turn on anymore! (of course, with smc in place).

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Bad solders, or SMC?
Check basic voltages and signals.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message:
Tried with both the old and the new SMC. Board no longer turns on with the battery or SMC bypass!

I checked the voltages, same situation as before.

threads.title: 820-3115 - no green light
threads.message: Post some voltages and signals from power on sequence.
